page.title: 20The Railway, Blackridge
page.content:
The railway grew busier when the {coal mining}started in Blackridge. There was a railway station and a signal box at{Westcraigs.}The signal box was taken away about 1980-81. The railway tracks were also taken away about 1983.
{* * * * *
Before the tracks were taken away they carried vehicles for{British {Leyland}in Bathgate to Glasgow. Part of the railway station is still at Westcraigs but it has been changed into a house. You can still see the{platforms}but part of them have been knocked down.
